intro: Helipterum simplex, commonly known as the simple helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Helipterum simplex is a perennial herb that is well adapted to withstand drought conditions.
